item.title: Trump Rescinds Canada’s Invitation to Join His ‘Board of Peace’
item.description: The president appeared to be lashing out in response to stark, high-profile remarks by Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada that rejected Mr. Trump’s efforts to dismantle the international order.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron and Matina Stevis-Gridneff

item.title: D.H.S. Cited Foreign Students’ Writings and Protests Before Their Arrests
item.description: Documents unsealed by a federal judge on Thursday include dossiers that investigators prepared on pro-Palestinian student activists before they were targeted for deportation.
item.dc:creator: Zach Montague
item.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
item.media:description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio approved the revocation of visas for five international students last year.

item.title: National Park Service Dismantles Slavery Exhibit in Philadelphia
item.description: The exhibit memorialized nine people enslaved by George Washington. The Park Service said it was being removed in accordance with a directive from President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Ahn
item.media:description: An outdoor exhibit on slavery at Independence National Historical Park in Philadelphia in October. The National Park Service has taken down the exhibit.

item.title: White House Posts Altered Photo Showing Arrested Minnesota Protester Crying
item.description: The New York Times ran the image posted by Kristi Noem, the homeland security secretary, as well as the one posted by the White House through an A.I. detection system. It concluded that the White House’s version showed signs of manipulation.
item.dc:creator: Tiffany Hsu, Alan Feuer and Stuart A. Thompson
item.media:description: Nekima Levy Armstrong after speaking at an anti-ICE rally in St. Paul, Minn., on Monday. The Justice Department said on Thursday morning that it had taken her into custody, accusing her of helping to interrupt a church service in St. Paul.

item.title: F.A.A. Says Helicopter Restrictions Imposed After D.C. Crash Will Stay
item.description: The agency said that expanding the restrictions and making them permanent were urgent steps for avoiding another crash.
item.dc:creator: Karoun Demirjian
item.media:description: The new rule for Ronald Reagan National Airport sets strict limits on what “essential operations” could be excepted from the airspace restrictions.

item.title: Nazis, Soviets and Trump: America’s Fixation With Greenland
item.description: The idea that Greenland is essential to the United States has returned with a vengeance in the Trump era.
item.dc:creator: Michael Crowley
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:description: A Greenlander with his dog sled looking at the Americans’ Thule Air Base in northern Greenland in 1966.

item.title: Big Insurers Try to Shift Blame for High Health Costs to Hospitals and Drug Makers
item.description: At two congressional hearings, lawmakers slammed executives of major companies, saying they were failing to rein in the cost of medical care for consumers.
item.dc:creator: Reed Abelson
item.category: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
Blue Cross and Blue Shield Assn
item.media:description: Stephen Hemsley, chief executive of UnitedHealth Group, left, defended insurers’ practices, along with other companies’ executives, during congressional hearings on Thursday.

item.title: U.S. Formally Withdraws From World Health Organization
item.description: Global health experts worry that a lack of international coordination will lead to death and disaster.
item.dc:creator: Sheryl Gay Stolberg
item.category: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
item.media:description: The World Health Organization’s headquarters in Geneva. The Trump administration said that all U.S. government funding to the organization had been terminated.

item.title: Mark Carney Says Firmly That ‘Canada Doesn’t Live Because of the United States’
item.description: The Canadian prime minister spoke after returning from the World Economic Forum where he urged middle powers to team up in resisting President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Ian Austen
item.media:description: Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada at a news conference in Quebec City on Thursday.

item.title: Trump Could Begin Flying on Plane Donated by Qatar by Summer
item.description: It remains unclear whether the aircraft would get the full Air Force One security upgrades, which industry experts said could take up to two years to complete.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Pager and Eric Schmitt
item.media:description: President Trump had to swap to a smaller plane used as Air Force One on Tuesday night, as he was heading to Switzerland, after an electrical issue with the larger aircraft.

item.title: RFK Jr. Plan to Test a Vaccine in West African Babies Is Blocked
item.description: A planned U.S.-funded study of a hepatitis B vaccine drew widespread condemnation from researchers. Now the host country says it cannot proceed.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Nolen and Christina Jewett
item.category: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
item.media:description: Each year thousands of babies born in Guinea-Bissau, one of the world’s least developed countries, are exposed to hepatitis B, a virus that can cause severe liver damage and cancer.

item.title: House Rejects Measure to Bar Military Force in Venezuela
item.description: In a tie vote, the House defeated an effort to prohibit the president from using the U.S. military in Venezuela weeks after the raid he ordered that captured the country’s leader.
item.dc:creator: Robert Jimison
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:description: Representative Jim McGovern, Democrat of Massachusetts, at the Capitol on Wednesday. Mr. McGovern, the top Democrat on the Rules Committee, led the effort to bar military force in Venezuela.

item.title: Trump to Expand ‘Mexico City’ Abortion Rule to Include D.E.I. and Gender
item.description: The policy has traditionally been aimed at keeping organizations that receive U.S. tax dollars from performing or promoting abortion as a method of family planning.
item.dc:creator: Sheryl Gay Stolberg
item.category: Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria
item.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump both reinstated and expanded the “Mexico City policy” in January 2017. His administration is set to broaden the policy again.

item.title: House Passes Spending Package Over Democratic Revolt on ICE
item.description: Approval of the package, which would fund a wide swath of government agencies, brings Congress closer to meeting a Jan. 30 funding deadline.
item.dc:creator: Catie Edmondson
item.media:description: Federal agents in Minneapolis this month, the week after an ICE agent fatally shot Renee Good. Democrats in the House had said they would not vote for legislation that provided funding for ICE, at least not without major changes.

item.title: Takeaways From Jack Smith’s Testimony on Trump Investigations
item.description: In his remarks, the former special counsel repeatedly denied that he had acted out of partisan animus and bemoaned the Trump administration’s efforts to go after the president’s perceived enemies.
item.dc:creator: Alan Feuer and Glenn Thrush
item.category: Federal Criminal Case Against Trump (Documents Case)
item.media:description: Jack Smith, the former special counsel, urged the lawmakers on Thursday to stand up for the rule of the law.

item.title: Fine Arts Panel, Remade by Trump, Indicates Support for His Ballroom Plan
item.description: The president has stacked a commission with allies as he has pushed to construct a 90,000-square-foot addition to the White House. A federal judge signaled he might block the project.
item.dc:creator: Luke Broadwater and Zach Montague
item.media:description: A rendering of the proposed White House ballroom in the Oval Office last month.

item.title: An Emboldened Trump’s Whipsaw Approach to the World
item.description: He says there’s a method to the madness. But European allies wonder whether the United States is reliable anymore.
item.dc:creator: Zolan Kanno-Youngs
item.media:description: President Trump at a reception with business leaders at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, on Wednesday.

item.title: Judge Rejects DOJ’s Criminal Complaint Against Don Lemon Over Minnesota Church Protest
item.description: The Justice Department would seek to find other avenues to pursue a case against Mr. Lemon, a senior law enforcement official said.
item.dc:creator: Devlin Barrett, Alan Feuer and Glenn Thrush
item.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
item.media:description: Don Lemon reporting from a demonstration in Broadview, Ill., last year. Mr. Lemon, a former CNN anchor, has said he was at the Minnesota protest as a journalist.

item.title: House Votes to Strip Senators of New Avenue to Sue Government
item.description: The unanimous vote amounted to a bipartisan rebuke of the Senate after leaders in that chamber slipped the legal provision into legislation to reopen the government.
item.dc:creator: Catie Edmondson
item.media:description: The Capitol in Washington.

item.title: Amy Klobuchar Files Papers for Run to Succeed Tim Walz as Minnesota Governor
item.description: The Minnesota senator, a potential 2028 presidential candidate, appears set to enter a race that has been transformed by President Trump’s immigration crackdown in the state and protests against it.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Lerer, Reid J. Epstein and Ernesto Londoño
item.media:description: Senator Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota is widely expected to clear the Democratic primary field for governor of her home state.

item.title: Five Fronts in Trump’s Culture War
item.description: In the first year of his second term, President Trump has made sweeping efforts to influence the arts and media in America.
item.dc:creator: Graham Bowley
item.category: Kennedy, John F, Center for the Performing Arts
item.media:description: During a White House dinner in October, President Trump showed models of a triumphal arch he is planning to build in Washington.

item.title: When a Coat Becomes a Symbol of Conflict
item.description: How the choice of outerwear for Gregory Bovino, the president’s Border Patrol chief, turned into part of the deportation story.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.media:description: Gregory Bovino, who leads Border Patrol operations, flanked by federal agents in Minneapolis in January.

item.title: Trump Returns to a Familiar Role: Sowing Trade Chaos
item.description: The president’s quick reversal on tariffs over Greenland was another sign of his willingness to rip up the international order — even parts of it that he himself has made.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson
item.media:description: President Trump on Wednesday gave a menacing speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, before backtracking on a brewing trade war with Europe.

item.title: Protester Nekima Levy Armstrong Who Interrupted Minnesota Church Service Is Arrested, Officials Say
item.description: A standoff between demonstrators and congregants at Cities Church in St. Paul on Sunday added to tensions around federal immigration enforcement in the state.
item.dc:creator: Jacey Fortin and Lauren McCarthy
item.media:description: Cities Church in St. Paul, Minn. Protesters interrupted a service there on Sunday, calling attention to a pastor’s apparent work as an ICE official.

item.title: Europe’s Leaders Scramble to Find a Path Forward With Trump
item.description: Leaders from across the European Union held an emergency summit in Brussels to discuss Greenland and, more broadly, their fragile relationship with America.
item.dc:creator: Jeanna Smialek
item.media:description: President Trump addressing the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, on Wednesday.

item.title: Friedrich Merz, German Chancellor, Urges Europe to Spend Big on Defense
item.description: Speaking in Davos, Chancellor Friedrich Merz also implicitly criticized President Trump’s demeaning treatment of European allies.
item.dc:creator: Jim Tankersley
item.media:description: At the World Economic Forum on Thursday, Friedrich Merz, the chancellor of Germany, urged European countries to strengthen their militaries.

item.title: The Voters Who Have Taken a U-Turn on Trump
item.description: One year later, the second Trump coalition has come apart, a Times/Siena poll finds.
item.dc:creator: Nate Cohn
item.media:credit: Marco Postigo Storel for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump has lost a lot of support among the young, some of whom protested outside Trump Tower in New York on Tuesday.

item.title: Jack Smith Testifies in House Hearing About Trump Investigations
item.description: The former special prosecutor argued a case he was never allowed to in court: that President Trump “engaged in criminal activity” that undermined democracy.
item.dc:creator: Glenn Thrush and Alan Feuer
item.category: Federal Criminal Case Against Trump (Documents Case)
item.media:description: Jack Smith, the special prosecutor who twice indicted Donald J. Trump, at the Capitol on Thursday.

item.title: Few Voters Say Trump’s Second Term Has Made the Country Better, Poll Finds
item.description: A majority of voters said that Mr. Trump had focused on the wrong priorities and that they disapproved of his handling of top issues, but the president still enjoys strong support from Republicans.
item.dc:creator: Shane Goldmacher, Ruth Igielnik and Camille Baker

item.title: America Turns 250: A Guide to the Coming Festivities
item.description: Girl Scouts singing folk songs, a flag-waving party and a Times Square ball drop are among the planned Semiquincentennial celebrations.
item.dc:creator: Steven Kurutz
item.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times

item.title: Zelensky Meets With Trump at Davos Forum to Discuss Ukraine Peace Deal
item.description: President Trump and Ukraine’s leader, Volodymyr Zelensky, are expected to talk about sticking points in negotiations to end the war with Russia.
item.dc:creator: Constant Méheut
item.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
item.media:description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine will meet President Trump on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.
